intro: Schkuhria wislizeni var. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
